elements.name: stackName
elements.label: Stack Name
elements.toolTip: Stack name

elements.name: certificateType
elements.label: Certificate Type
elements.toolTip:
[[selfsigned] Not recommended for production use. If you don't have a FQDN, (DomainName parameter) you can use this option to generate a self-signed certificate.
[owncert] Valid for productions environments. If you have a FQDN, (DomainName parameter)
and an Elastic IP, you can use this option to use your own certificate.
[letsencrypt] Valid for production environments. If you have a FQDN, (DomainName parameter)
and an Elastic IP, you can use this option to generate a Let's Encrypt certificate.

elements.name: publicIpAddress
elements.label: Public Ip Address
elements.toolTip: Previously created Public IP address for the OpenVidu Deployment. Blank will generate a public IP

elements.name: publicIpAddressResourceName
elements.label: Public Ip Address Resource Name
elements.toolTip: Name of the PublicIPAddress resource in your azure if you have a resource of publicIPAddress

elements.name: domainName
elements.label: Domain Name
elements.toolTip: Domain name for the OpenVidu Deployment. Blank will generate default domain

elements.name: ownPublicCertificate
elements.label: Own Public Certificate
elements.toolTip: If certificate type is 'owncert', this parameter will be used to specify the public certificate

elements.name: ownPrivateCertificate
elements.label: Own Private Certificate
elements.toolTip: If certificate type is 'owncert', this parameter will be used to specify the private certificate

elements.name: letsEncryptEmail
elements.label: Lets Encrypt Email
elements.toolTip: If certificate type is 'letsencrypt', this email will be used for Let's Encrypt notifications

elements.name: turnDomainName
elements.label: Turn Domain Name
elements.toolTip: (Optional) Domain name for the TURN server with TLS. Only needed if your users are behind restrictive firewalls

elements.name: turnOwnPublicCertificate
elements.label: Turn Own Public Certificate
elements.toolTip: (Optional) This setting is applicable if the certificate type is set to 'owncert' and the TurnDomainName is specified.

elements.name: turnOwnPrivateCertificate
elements.label: Turn Own Private Certificate
elements.toolTip: (Optional) This setting is applicable if the certificate type is set to 'owncert' and the TurnDomainName is specified.

elements.name: openviduLicense
elements.toolTip: Visit https://openvidu.io/account

elements.name: rtcEngine
elements.label: Rtc Engine
elements.toolTip: RTCEngine media engine to use

elements.name: masterNodeInstanceType
elements.label: Master Node Instance Type
elements.toolTip: Specifies the EC2 instance type for your OpenVidu Master Node

elements.name: mediaNodeInstanceType
elements.label: Media Node Instance Type
elements.toolTip: Specifies the EC2 instance type for your OpenVidu Media Nodes

elements.name: adminUsername
elements.label: Admin Username
elements.toolTip: Username for the Virtual Machine.

validations.message: User name cannot contain special characters \/\"[]:|<>+=;,?*@ or end with '.', and must be between 1 and 15 characters.
The specified username is not allowed. Please choose a different value.

elements.name: adminSshKey
elements.toolTip: SSH Key or password for the Virtual Machine

elements.name: initialNumberOfMediaNodes
elements.label: Initial Number Of Media Nodes
elements.toolTip: Number of initial media nodes to deploy

elements.name: minNumberOfMediaNodes
elements.label: Min Number Of Media Nodes
elements.toolTip: Minimum number of media nodes to deploy

elements.name: maxNumberOfMediaNodes
elements.label: Max Number Of Media Nodes
elements.toolTip: Maximum number of media nodes to deploy

elements.name: scaleTargetCPU
elements.label: Scale Target CPU
elements.toolTip: Target CPU percentage to scale up or down

elements.name: automationAccountName
elements.label: Automation Account Name
elements.toolTip: Automation Account Name to create a runbook inside it for scale in

elements.name: storageAccountName
elements.label: Storage Account Name
elements.toolTip: Name of the existing storage account. It is essential that this parameter is filled just when you want to save recordings and still using the same container after an update. If not specified, a new storage account will be generated.

elements.name: containerName
elements.label: Container Name
elements.toolTip: Name of the bucket where OpenVidu will store the recordings. If not specified, a default bucket will be created.
